intro: Acinodendron serrulatum, commonly known as the serrated acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with serrated edges. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
